did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: First Unitarian Church of Ithaca, New York records, 1861-1986.
did.physdesc: Constitutions, board minutes, correspondence, financial records, and other records.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Constitutions, board minutes, correspondence, financial records, and numerous other records of the church.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Constitutions, board minutes, correspondence, financial records, and numerous other records of the church.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: First Unitarian Church of Ithaca, New York records, #4590. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Friarworks: About Boards and Committees, by R. Fulghum

scopecontent.p: Prose piece written by Robert L. Fulghum, Executive Director, Pacific Northwest District
Essay written apropos of: George Lincoln Burr, by Roland H. Bainton" reprinted from ISIS, No. 100, Spring of 1944.

did.unittitle: V.D.'s Stories as Told by Virgil D. Morse - 1861-1937.

scopecontent.p: Bound typescript volume, Compiled by Lillian Shaben and Robert V. Morse. Signed, "Presented to the First Unitarian Society of Ithaca, by Robert V. Morse, Dec. 1945"
Bound volume. "These essays portray my slow attempt to understand the world of history and international politics."
Bound manuscript volume with Constitution of 1871 and Board Minutes 1903-1913.
Bound manuscript volume of Board Minutes 1914-1917.
Bound manuscript volume of Board Minutes Oct-Nov 1917
Correspondence, Board Minutes, Reports
Unitarian Service Pension society, Proposed Amendment to Constitution Dec 28, 1928
AUA Resolution on Anti-Semitism
Resolution of impartiality by Morse, R.V. 1947; List of Wills 1946, Excerpts from by-laws of AUA

R.E. Program, Excerpts from AUA By-Laws, Proposed union between Universalists and Unitarians, Proposals for democratizing structure of AUA, Displaced persons Committee and interpreters, USC Appeal, AUA Resolutions May 1950
Heizer Club, Copy of Section 164, Religious Corporations Law June 1951
Proposed revision of by-laws Oct 1951, Resolution Nov 5 1951, Constitution as amended to Jan 4 1952, UU Commission on Federal Union Mar 12 1952, Church expansion discussions
Resolution regarding religion and politics by R.V. Morse Mar 2 1953, Constitution as amended to Apr. 23, 1953
Church expansion committee report, letters regarding radio sermons
Church as emergency hospital Oct 1954Church expansion report Jan 3 1955, Parish list Jan 1955
Constitution as amended to Apr. 23, 1957
Letter re: international assoc. for religious freedom Nov 1957; Letter re: building new church, April 23 1958; Letter re: Parsonage, Apr. 23, 1958; Consideration of Teele House, Apr. 23 1958
New Parish house, expansion fund, pulpit committee, statement on merger of Unitarians with Universalists
Hazel's Backyard
China Study Group
Parlor Project
Tompkins County Day Care
Grant Proposal to Universalists; New Organ Funding
Final Report to Universalists re: Program for Developing Contemporary Music; Festival of Music Project
Proposal to VEATCH Committee
Alma Russell Garden
Copy of Tax Exemption Letter of 1962; Constitution as Amended May 23, 1978
PARKIT
Sabbatic Leave; Planning and Development Study
Military Draft Counseling; Church Bond Resolution; Goals Checklist
Bids for Roof work; Drawing of Roof
Painting Contract 1980; Roof Repairs Contract 1983

did.unittitle: Emergency Evacuation Instructions, Parish House and Church Basement

Reports, Contracts and Bids for heating and insulation work, 1980
Building and Grounds; Building Permits; Maintenance Reports
Rental Agreements; Day Care

Appraisal and Sale of 212 Fall Creek Drive
Summary Report of 1958 Real Estate Transactions for 407 E. Buffalo; 212 Fall Creek Drive; 306 N. Aurora Street
Policies for Use and Rental of Church
Reports about Church Safety Systems; 1973 proposal from Simplex Time Recorder Co. for Smoke, Heat and Fire Detection Equipment.
In response to thefts at the church, tighter security and more control over building keys was instituted.
Master Copy of Form, "Using the Sound System"
Contracts and Bid Proposals for Steeple Repair Work.
Bond Resolution, Nov 11 1980; Mortgage Agreement

did.unittitle: Area Congregations Together; Meals on Wheels; Kitchen Cupboard (1982-1983; 1981-1982; 1982-1984)

scopecontent.p: Copies of Unitarian with notices of activities; Annual program for ACT 1982
Letter from Ithaca City Clerk about the Church as a Polling Place in 1980.
Energy Audit Report 1984.
Information and letters concerning establishment of a Draft Counseling center if the US Senate approved a Peacetime Draft.
Explanatory circular on the EOS. Names Hazel Brampton, church member.

did.unittitle: Federation of Churches of Ithaca and Vicinity

scopecontent.p: Letter and copy of the Constitution of the Federation of Churches of Ithaca and Vicinity.
Program for the Ithaca Council of Church Women, World Day of Prayer, Service at Unitarian Church March 8, 1957.
Prevent Alcohol Related Killings and Injuries in Tompkins County - circular listing church members.

did.unittitle: Sponsor of Tompco Better Housing Inc.

scopecontent.p: Letter accepting Unitarian Church as sponsor of the program. Booklets from Tompso B.H. program.
